title: Nestle Toll House Chocolate Chip Pie Recipe
description: This chocolate chip pie is delicious and boasts a sweet, soft, chewy brown sugar cookie base studded with chopped nuts and rich chocolate morsels.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Desserts Nestle Toll House Chocolate Chip Pie 4.6 (65) 48 Reviews 17 Photos Nestle Toll House chocolate chip pie features the sweet, creamy richness of a brown sugar base combined with chopped nuts and delicious chocolate morsels. Can be served with ice cream instead of whipped cream. Submitted by Nestle Toll House Updated on June 23, 2023 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 17 17 17 17 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 55 mins Total Time: 1 hr 10 mins Servings: 8 Yield: 1 9-inch pie Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 2 large eggs ½ cup all-purpose flour ½ cup granulated sugar ½ cup packed brown sugar ¾ cup butter, softened 1 cup Nestle Toll House Semi-Sweet Chocolate Morsels 1 cup chopped nuts 1 (9 inch) frozen deep-dish pie crust, thawed 1 cup whipped cream, or to taste Directions Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Beat eggs in a large mixing bowl on high speed until foamy. Beat in flour, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until combined. Beat in butter until smooth. Stir in chocolate morsels and chopped nuts. Spoon mixture into pie shell. Bake in the preheated oven until a knife inserted halfway between the edge and center comes out clean, 55 to 60 minutes. Cool on a wire rack. Serve warm with whipped cream. I Made It Print 212 home cooks made it! Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Nestle Toll House Chocolate Chip Pie 01 of 17 Photo by  humblepieliving 02 of 17 Photo by  JollyRum7087 11/07/2024 I made this exactly as it said to, and it came out like a butter soup. But I was determined and made it perfectly with these adjustments: 1 stick of butter, 1/2 cup + 1 tablespoons flour, Pinch or 2 of salt, and a Dash of butter flavor. It came out still quite gooey and DELICIOUS!! 03 of 17 Photo by  MirthStraw3339 08/23/2024 A keeper! I made 3 for a school pie auction. I’ve never made this before and all 3 came out perfectly! 04 of 17 Photo by  WorthyApple1588 11/25/2022 First time trying this recipe. It is so good, I am not a huge fan of pie crust, but with this recipe I couldn't taste the crust at all. Moist beyond belief and not too sweet. I added whipped cream and milk chocolate chips on top. Simple and delicious this is a new desert that will now be made often in my household. 05 of 17 Photo by  humblepieliving 10/27/2022 Our kids loved this pie, and I loved the texture of it! The only thing missing was a pinch of salt in the batter. 06 of 17 Photo by  dinosaurnut 04/24/2021 07 of 17 Photo by  Sharon 04/17/2020 08 of 17 Photo by  Nora Wehmer 03/15/2019 09 of 17 Photo by  Beng B 11/22/2018 10 of 17 Photo by  Beng B 11/22/2018 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Tricia's Fantastic Fudge Pie 59 Ratings Chocolate Chip Cookie Pie 95 Ratings Chocolate Chip Pie III 69 Ratings Chocolate Bourbon Pecan Pie 671 Ratings Easy Chocolate Tofu Pie 97 Ratings Chocolate Chip Kahlua® Pecan Pie 4 Ratings Derby Pie 2 Ratings Chocolate Pecan Pie II 13 Ratings Pretzel Fudge Pie 2 Ratings Milk Chocolate Pecan Pie 79 Ratings Cranberry Arctic Freeze Pie Pecan Chocolate Chip Pie 19 Ratings Double Chocolate Pie 311 Ratings Cannoli Crumb Pie 2 Ratings Super Easy Peanut Chocolate Chip Cookie Pie 1 Rating Hawaiian Chocolate Macadamia Nut Tart 5 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Nestle Toll House
instructions: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).;Beat eggs in a large mixing bowl on high speed until foamy. Beat in flour, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until combined. Beat in butter until smooth. Stir in chocolate morsels and chopped nuts. Spoon mixture into pie shell.;Bake in the preheated oven until a knife inserted halfway between the edge and center comes out clean, 55 to 60 minutes. Cool on a wire rack. Serve warm with whipped cream.
